page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This block lies just to the south of Wigan town centre. It includes Newtown, Goose Green and Lower Ince and one of Britain's largest areas of derelict industrial landscape, now being slowly reclaimed by nature. Many other changes have taken place. Unemployment and broken marriages are widespread. Lower Ince is shrinking as old terraced houses are demolished, while new private housing spreads out at Hawkley Hall and Marus Bridge drawing some "incomers" from Merseyside. These shifts are reflected in imminent school reorganisation. However the population is remarkably static. There are differences of speech and identity between, say, the Newtown and Ince communities. Working-class traditions of diet, sport, churchgoing, clubs and voting Labour are still kept; and local pride, if insular, is warm.
